intro: Sabal, commonly known as the cabbage palm, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Americas, particularly found in the southeastern United States, the Caribbean, and parts of Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their tall, slender trunks and large, fan-shaped leaves that can reach several feet in diameter. Sabal species are often used in landscaping due to their ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. They also play an important ecological role in their native habitats by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
